dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...twenty, even thirty professions that, like, just vanish within a decade, and you're just like, "Whoa, how do I even prepare for that?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...twenty, even thirty professions that, like, just vanish within a decade, and you're just like, Whoa, how do I even prepare for that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When they hear about 10, 20 or 30 professions which vanish within a decade, it is very natural to ask a simple question: How can they best prepare for their future career in such a rapidly changing and unpredictable world?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's wild! And, um, it really makes you think about, like, what actually matters for your career, you know? What's future-proof?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's wild! And, um, it really makes you think about, like, what actually matters for your career, you know? What's future-proof?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And, uh, top of the list for me? Project management skills. Seriously, they're universal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And, uh, top of the list for me? Project management skills. Seriously, they're universal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, some skills are universal and applicable in many fields. One such skill is project management.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, almost every job description, you see it, right? "Must have project management experience." It's, um, it's not going anywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, almost every job description, you see it, right? Must have project management experience. It's, um, it's not going anywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indeed you will find almost every job description calls for project management skills or project management experience, as more and more companies and organizations build their work and activities around specific projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, and it's not just a buzzword, either. I mean, the UN Global Workforce Initiative in 2018, like, mandated project-based training!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, and it's not just a buzzword, either. I mean, the U N Global Workforce Initiative in twenty eighteen, like, mandated project-based training!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's huge! And it kinda ties into, uh, multitasking too, doesn't it? Managing all those projects at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's huge! And it kinda ties into, uh, multitasking too, doesn't it? Managing all those projects at once.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! Although, um, multitasking is kinda controversial, some people are like, "No, don't do it!" But honestly, in this modern world, it's kinda unavoidable, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! Although, um, multitasking is kinda controversial, some people are like, No, don't do it! But honestly, in this modern world, it's kinda unavoidable, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Multitasking an ability to perform several tasks (or manage several projects) at the same time is a highly controversial field in modern debates about the workplace productivity. ... The reality is that in the modern complex world multitasking is unavoidable and multitasking skills are highly valued.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It totally is! But speaking of unavoidable, communication skills, like, wow. You could have the best idea, but if you can't talk about it...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It totally is! But speaking of unavoidable, communication skills, like, wow. You could have the best idea, but if you can't talk about it...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indeed, you can have the brightest and most innovative idea, but if you fail to communicate it to your friends and colleagues, the idea will be lost: in fact, the first 50 prototypes of the iPhone failed and kept failing until the innovative team learned to communicate between each other better.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, the Oxford Institute for Communications Research, they found people with strong communication earn 15% more! Fifteen percent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, the Oxford Institute for Communications Research, they found people with strong communication earn fifteen percent more! Fifteen percent!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A-huh! And, um, not just talking, but also, like, advanced digital skills, right? Basic computer knowledge just isn't cutting it anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A-huh! And, um, not just talking, but also, like, advanced digital skills, right? Basic computer knowledge just isn't cutting it anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this environment, having basic computer knowledge is not enough.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all! It's not just about, like, knowing how to use email. It's virtuoso Microsoft Office, it's coding, it's advanced internet business skills.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all! It's not just about, like, knowing how to use email. It's virtuoso Microsoft Office, it's coding, it's advanced internet business skills.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Employers demand recent graduates be capable of everything from using the internet efficiently to producing virtuoso work on Microsoft Office, and from software coding to advance internet business skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! Like, the World Economic Forum survey, wasn't it, uh, 40% increase in demand for advanced digital skills in just three years? Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! Like, the World Economic Forum survey, wasn't it, uh, forty percent increase in demand for advanced digital skills in just three years? Wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Forty percent! Unbelievable. But then, the real kicker, the one thing AI can't easily replace? Emotional intelligence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forty percent! Unbelievable. But then, the real kicker, the one thing A I can't easily replace? Emotional intelligence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Emotional intelligence cant be easily replaced by technology

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! That's, um, so critical! Especially with, like, more machines and less in-person, you need that human connection.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! That's, um, so critical! Especially with, like, more machines and less in-person, you need that human connection.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Paradoxically many corporate leaders increasingly talk about and highly value emotional intelligence, despite the fact we use more machines and robots than ever before and now communicate more online than in person.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's about dealing with emotions, building positive workplace environments. It's, uh, it's everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's about dealing with emotions, building positive workplace environments. It's, uh, it's everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a nutshell, emotional intelligence is your ability to deal effectively with emotions, create appropriate emotional relations with each other, communicate competently with workplace teams, and intelligently and appropriately use emotional information to create a positive workplace environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, that's the real differentiator, isn't it? So important for, um, like, every single interaction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, that's the real differentiator, isn't it? So important for, um, like, every single interaction.
